page.title: 17HOME LIFE
page.content: Our group consists of five people who live in a small, cosy village called Jemimaville in the Scottish Highlands where the sea is about 15metres from the bottom of most peoples gardens. We get up between 7.30 and 8.30 in the morning to have our breakfasts and catch the bus at 8.50. We arrive at school at 9.00 and wait until the bell rings at 9.15 when we start our work. We always do some reading, writing, spelling and maths before the bell rings at 10.45 for interval. Then the boys sometimes play football until the bell rings at 11.15. We usually do some English until 12.30 when we have lunch, which on most days consists of vegetables, meat and potatoes with pudding or milk to follow. Lunch is cooked in the nearby school of Cromarty about six miles away
